DataElement.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Version 4 Q1 Satisfied with Sex Life No Answer Preference Checkbox Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text field to capture the checkbox indicator that signifies whether or not a person prefers to answer a question about satisfaction with their sex life.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Satisfied with Sex Life Negation Answer Preference Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G._A survey question about whether a person is satisfied with their sex life.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.:The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's satisfaction with their sex life.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.
The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: FACT-G (Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - General)

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
